page.title: 17ECOSYSTEM
page.content: Only the wooded areas covering the steep valley sides around Rhydymwyn and the Gwysaney woodland area provide shelter and food for the largest range of plants and animals including the fox,badger,squirrel, rabbit, woodpecker, and other birdlife.Large numbers of some wild animals have become a nuisance and recurring myxamatosis amount rabbits is a sign of previous attempts to control their numbers.Industry has aroused more public reaction as the planned expansion of the unsightly fire- lighter factory in Rhosesmor threatens to spoil the area further. The white dust from the quarry north of Rhydymwyn and the transport used is another nuisance, thickly coating vegetation, houses and cars.
